result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawn M Gattie was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs and supervision fees.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Drug and alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances or alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

No violent contact with family members.   Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Take all medications as prescribed.  Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law. Defedant shall participate and successfully complete the Racine County Alcohol/Drug Treatment Program.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Shawn M Gattie in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  W. Richard Chiapete appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 29, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Helmi Hamad
Preliminary hearing at 12-16-2015 09:00 am

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Defendant to receive medication at prescribed times while in the RCJ.   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant  NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances - bond condition(s) to be monitored by Zimmerman Consulting Inc., located at 524 S Main Street in Racine (262-632-1780).  You are to report to their office immediately following your hearing.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Shawn M Gattie in court with attorney Gretchen G. Rosenke.  Defendant Shawn M Gattie in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Lori Thornton.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 09:00 am.
